pages.title: The Churches
pages.heroSubtitle: Churches in the Mission Life Grace Network
pages.metaDescription: The churches in the Mission Life Grace network

sections.title: Churches coming together for the Kingdom
sections.content:
Mission Life Grace is a network of churches working together to see the Kingdom of God come, where broken lives are restored, the lost are found and communities transformed.

Each church in our network is unique, yet we share a common vision and values. Together, we support one another, learn from each other, and work collaboratively to make a difference in our communities and beyond.
sections.label: A network of churches

heroSlides.title: The churches
heroSlides.subtitle: Churches in the Mission Life Grace Network

pages.title: Values
pages.metaDescription: The values of Mission Life Grace - What makes us who we are
pages.content: We believe that God creates each movement of churches distinct, destined to fulfil a divinely appointed purpose for a specific time, with different emphasis according to the will of God. We believe that these distinctives are important as they make a difference in how we live and how we minister. As a family of churches we unite around them, we strive for them, these are the things that matter to us.

sections.title: What makes us who we are
sections.description: We believe that God creates each movement of churches distinct, destined to fulfil a divinely appointed purpose for a specific time, with different emphasis according to the will of God. We believe that these distinctives are important as they make a difference in how we live and how we minister. As a family of churches we unite around them, we strive for them, these are the things that matter to us.

values.title: ENJOYING GOD
values.description: We want to be a joyful people, who enjoy and celebrate Jesus Christ as our Lord and saviour, knowing we are loved, accepted and made righteous by Him. Our relationship with Jesus Christ is the fire that motivates all we do, it is not motivated by a religious principle or philosophy but by our love for Him.

values.title: THE LORDSHIP OF CHRIST
values.description: We recognise the foundational significance of the simple truth that it is no longer I who live but Christ who lives in me. We must die to sin and our selfish desires and live new lives unto God. Our lives and churches are built on this principle and we seek to joyfully live holy, righteous and generous lives that are pleasing to God. We acknowledge our inability to live holy lives without the ongoing power of the life of Christ within.

values.title: SPIRIT & WORD
values.description: As churches we seek to walk in and minister in the power of the Holy Spirit. The Holy Spirit brings vitality to the life of a believer and a church and guides our decision making. We believe the Bible to be the word of God and it's authority is final, therefore our desire to move with the Holy Spirit will never be contradictory to the Bible. We believe the Spirit illuminates the Bible bringing revelation of the heart and will of God for believers and the church.

values.title: PRAYER
values.description: We believe in the vital importance of prayer in the life of a Christian and a church, prayer is the means by which we find the joy of the Lord and the knowledge of his will. We believe that prayer births, grows and establishes the work of God in our lives and our churches. God has chosen to work through the prayers of His people and It is our delight and commitment to cooperate with God in His purposes and see the fulfilment of the things we pray for.

values.title: ORDINARY PEOPLE
values.description: We are humbled by the fact that Christ has entrusted the Gospel to us through the power of His Spirit to see broken lives restored and the lost saved. Our churches seek to be consistently outwardly focused, seeking to reach and save the lost by encouraging and equipping every member to share the gospel. We are called to be sending churches, who help equip and release ordinary people on mission as pioneers willing to go to new places and take the gospel wherever we can as ordinary people with an extraordinary God.

values.title: THE CHURCH
values.description: We believe the manifold wisdom of God is displayed through the church, which is expressed through local churches. A local church which is operating as Christ intended by loving each other and seeking to share the gospel with those who live around us is God's primary means for establishing His kingdom on earth. We seek to plant churches, where the gospel can be proclaimed in new areas and believers are formed into families of disciples.

values.title: ELDERSHIP
values.description: Jesus Christ reigns as head over His church, and He gives to His church elders to oversee and lead local churches under His authority. We believe that men, qualified by both character and gifting, are to serve as elders, caring and serving those in the church.  We are deeply committed both to the fundamental spiritual and moral equality of male and female. Under the oversight of Eldership we believe that all people, male and female, can operate in leadership in various activities and ministries.

pages.title: Leadership Team
pages.heroSubtitle: MLG is overseen by a Leadership Team who work very closely with the local church leaders across the network.
pages.teamDescription: MLG is overseen by a Leadership Team who work very closely with the local church leaders across the network. The Leadership Team is focused on providing direction as well as supporting leaders across the churches.

pages.title: Home Page
pages.aboutContent:
Our aim is to see the Kingdom of God come, where broken lives are restored, the lost are found and communities transformed. We believe every church exists to be part of God's mission to show the world Christ and that we are better equipped to do this in partnership with other churches.

As a network our focus is to encourage each other through sharing our hearts, ideas and lessons learned along the way, to challenge one another to stay true to the course and to invest in helping people fulfil their God given calling. We believe that by journeying together we can see God do great things in our nation and around the world.
pages.metaDescription: Home page content and hero slides
pages.visionText: We believe every church exists to be part of God's mission to show the world Christ and that we are better equipped to do this in partnership with other churches. As a network our focus is to encourage each other through sharing our hearts, ideas and lessons learned along the way, to challenge one another to stay true to the course and to invest in helping people fulfil their God given calling. We believe that by journeying together we can see God do great things in our nation and around the world.

pages.title: Events
pages.heroSubtitle: Join us for training, networking, and community events
pages.metaDescription: Join us for training, networking, and community events
pages.content:
We love our local community

Come and enjoy a great coffee, tea or hot chocolate at Fresh Ground Coffee House. Or bring your child to Jumping Beans. If you are older you will enjoy Songs of the Sixties. Weekly food available through the Food Club, a great way to get fresh food at a very low cost.

All our activities are designed to serve and to share with our local community.

We look forward to welcoming you!

Fresh Ground Coffee House

Fresh Ground is our coffee shop which is open every week from Wednesday to Saturday from 9:30am to 2:00pm. Serving food and drink including the best coffee in Eltham.

This is a place where all can come and meet others. A real community cafe feel and activities that run for toddlers and olders.

View the website for more details: www.freshgroundeltham.co.uk

team.name: Tim Cross
team.quote: Tim heads up the MLG Leadership team. He is the pastor of the River Church in Orpington. Tim passionately believes that we are stronger together and that we need to see God release the potential in ordinary people. He is married to Helen and they have 3 young boys

team.name: John Watson
team.quote: John is the pastor of Eltham Green Community Church. John has a heart to see the local church engaged in reaching the world with the gospel. He also heads up Fresh Ground Coffee House as a means to reach the local community. He is married to Janna and they have 3 children.

team.name: Matt Chilvers
team.quote: Matt is a leader of City Church Chester. Matt's great desire is to see Jesus build His church and see a fresh outpouring of God in our nation. Matt has a busy schedule leading the church, managing a small construction firm and being the father to 3 children with his wife Charlotte.

events.title: Carols by Candlelight
events.eventInfo: Join us for a warm and peaceful evening as we gather to sing familiar carols and hear the Christmas story. It is a relaxed event for all ages, with candles, music, and a welcoming festive atmosphere. Bring friends and family, and take a moment to pause and enjoy the season together.

conferences.title: Annual Network Conference 2026
conferences.description:
Join us for an inspiring week


We are excited to invite you to our Annual Network Conference 2026! This year's theme is "Building Together in Faith" and we have an amazing lineup of speakers, workshops, and fellowship opportunities.


This conference is designed for the whole family, with programs for adults, teens, and children. We'll have worship sessions, teaching from the Word, practical workshops, and plenty of time for community and connection.
conferences.schedule:
Day 1


  1. Arrival, check in, and settling.
  2. Registration and a welcome session to open the conference.
  3. First main gathering or keynote to set the theme.
  4. Gentle afternoon sessions to ease people in.
  5. Evening focused on meeting others and building early connections.


Day 2


  1. First full content day with a strong morning keynote or main teaching.
  2. Workshops and breakouts that let people choose what fits their interests.
  3. Afternoon sessions that develop the core themes.
  4. Optional social time in the evening or space for informal conversations.


Day 3


  1. Deep dive day beginning with a major session or keynote.
  2. Hands on work, practical activities, or advanced workshops.
  3. More time spent in chosen tracks and collaborative spaces.
  4. Evening shaped by testimonies, creative activities, or open discussion.


Day 4


  1. Final morning gathering that draws everything together.
  2. Reflection groups or feedback time.
  3. Encouragement to plan next steps and apply what has been learned.
  4. Lunch, closing thanks, and departures.

faqs.question: What is included in the conference fee?
faqs.answer: The conference fee includes all sessions, materials, meals (Friday dinner through Sunday breakfast), and access to all activities. Accommodation is separate - see camping options or local hotel recommendations.

faqs.question: Is there accommodation available?
faqs.answer: Yes! We offer camping facilities on-site for those who want to stay. Alternatively, we have a list of recommended local hotels and B&Bs available upon request.

faqs.question: What about children and youth?
faqs.answer: We have dedicated programs for children (ages 0-12) and youth (ages 13-17) running throughout the conference. All children's workers are DBS checked and experienced in working with young people.

faqs.question: Can I register on the day?
faqs.answer: While we prefer advance registration, we do accept on-the-day registrations subject to availability. However, early bird pricing and meal guarantees are only available for advance bookings.

faqs.question: What if I need to cancel?
faqs.answer: Full refunds are available up to 30 days before the conference. After that, 50% refunds are available up to 14 days before. Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds within 14 days of the conference.

supportingPages.worshipAndMinistry:
Worship and Ministry

Join us for powerful times of worship and ministry throughout the conference. We will have dedicated worship sessions led by our worship team, and opportunities for prayer and ministry.

  • Morning worship sessions
  • Evening worship and ministry times
  • Prayer ministry available
supportingPages.kidsActivities:
Kids Activities

We have a fantastic program for children aged 0-12 years old. All activities are supervised by DBS-checked volunteers.

  • Age-appropriate teaching and activities
  • Games and crafts
  • Supervised play areas
  • Meal times together
supportingPages.youthActivities:
Youth Activities

Teens (13-17 years) will have their own dedicated program with relevant teaching, activities, and social time.

  • Youth-focused sessions
  • Team building activities
  • Social events
  • Mentorship opportunities
supportingPages.socialActivities:
Social Activities

There will be plenty of opportunities to connect and socialize throughout the conference.

  • Welcome reception
  • Networking breaks
  • Evening social events
  • Optional group outings
supportingPages.accommodation:
Accommodation

We offer on-site camping facilities for those who want to stay close to the action. Alternatively, we have a list of recommended local hotels and B&Bs.

  • On-site camping available
  • Local hotel recommendations
  • B&B options nearby
  • Contact us for more information
supportingPages.whatYouNeed:
What You Need

Here's what to bring with you to the conference:

  • Bible and notebook
  • Comfortable clothing
  • Weather-appropriate items
  • Any dietary requirements information
  • Camping gear (if camping)

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.content:
1. Introduction

Mission Life Grace ("we", "our", or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website and use our services, including conference bookings and event registrations.

By using our website, you consent to the data practices described in this policy. If you do not agree with the practices described in this policy, please do not use our services.

2. Information We Collect

2.1 Personal Information

We may collect the following types of personal information:

  • Contact Information: Name, email address, postal address
  • Booking Information: Conference and event registration details, ticket selections, payment information
  • Demographic Information: Age, date of birth (for age-appropriate events), home church or group affiliation
  • Medical and Emergency Information: For child and teen registrations, we collect emergency contact details, medical history, allergies, dietary restrictions, and consent waivers
  • Communication Preferences: Your preferences for receiving communications from us

2.2 Automatically Collected Information

When you visit our website, we may automatically collect certain information about your device and browsing behavior:

  • IP address
  • Browser type and version
  • Operating system
  • Pages visited and time spent on pages
  • Referring website addresses

3. How We Use Your Information

We use the information we collect for the following purposes:

  • To process and manage conference and event bookings
  • To communicate with you about your bookings, including confirmations, updates, and reminders
  • To process payments and manage financial transactions
  • To provide customer support and respond to your inquiries
  • To send you information about upcoming events, conferences, and church activities (with your consent)
  • To ensure the safety and well-being of attendees, particularly children and teens, by maintaining emergency contact and medical information
  • To comply with legal obligations and protect our legal rights
  • To improve our website and services

4. Information Sharing and Disclosure

We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. We may share your information in the following circumstances:

4.1 Service Providers

We may share information with third-party service providers who perform services on our behalf, including:

  • Payment Processors: PayPal for processing payments (see PayPal's privacy policy for their data practices)
  • Email Services: Resend for sending transactional and marketing emails
  • Hosting Providers: For website hosting and data storage

4.2 Legal Requirements

We may disclose your information if required by law or in response to valid legal requests, such as court orders or government regulations.

4.3 Safety and Emergency Situations

In emergency situations involving the safety of attendees, particularly children and teens, we may share relevant medical and emergency contact information with appropriate personnel, medical professionals, or emergency services.

4.4 Church Network

With your consent, we may share your information with other churches in the Mission Life Grace network for coordination of events and activities.

5. Data Storage and Security

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure.

Your data is stored on secure servers and is accessible only to authorized personnel who need access to perform their duties. We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this policy, unless a longer retention period is required by law.

6. Your Rights

Under UK data protection laws, you have the following rights:

  • Right to Access: You can request a copy of the personal information we hold about you
  • Right to Rectification: You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
  • Right to Erasure: You can request deletion of your personal information in certain circumstances
  • Right to Restrict Processing: You can request that we limit how we use your information
  • Right to Data Portability: You can request a copy of your data in a structured, machine-readable format
  • Right to Object: You can object to certain types of processing of your information
  • Right to Withdraw Consent: Where we rely on your consent, you can withdraw it at any time

To exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the contact information provided at the end of this policy.

7. Children's Privacy

We take the privacy of children very seriously. For child and teen registrations, we collect additional information including emergency contacts, medical information, and consent waivers. This information is used solely for the safety and well-being of the child during events and is shared only with authorized personnel and emergency services when necessary.

Parents or guardians have the right to access, correct, or delete their child's information at any time by contacting us.

8. Third-Party Links

Our website may contain links to third-party websites, such as PayPal for payments. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these external sites. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of any third-party sites you visit.

9. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date. You are advised to review this policy periodically for any changes.

10. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us:

Mission Life Grace

542 Westhorne Avenue, Eltham, London, SE9 6RR

Email: enquiries@missionlifegrace.net

termsAndConditions.title: Terms and Conditions
termsAndConditions.content:
1. Acceptance of Terms

By accessing and using the Mission Life Grace website and services, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our website or services.

2. Use of Website

You agree to use our website only for lawful purposes and in a way that does not infringe the rights of, restrict, or inhibit anyone else's use and enjoyment of the website.

You must not:

  • Use the website in any way that causes, or may cause, damage to the website or impairment of the availability or accessibility of the website
  • Use the website in any way that is unlawful, illegal, fraudulent, or harmful
  • Attempt to gain unauthorized access to any part of the website, server, or database
  • Transmit any malicious code, viruses, or harmful data
  • Collect or harvest any information or data from our website without our express written permission

3. Conference and Event Bookings

3.1 Booking Process

When booking tickets for conferences or events, you agree to provide accurate, current, and complete information. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your booking details and for all activities that occur under your booking.

3.2 Payment Terms

Payment for bookings can be made through PayPal. By completing a booking, you agree to pay the full amount specified at the time of booking. All prices are in British Pounds (GBP) unless otherwise stated.

We offer flexible payment options including full payment or installment plans (Pay in 3/4) where available. If you choose an installment plan, you agree to make all scheduled payments on time. Failure to complete payments may result in cancellation of your booking.

3.3 Booking Confirmation

Your booking is confirmed once payment is received and processed. You will receive a confirmation email with your booking reference and ticket details. Please keep this confirmation for your records.

3.4 Cancellations and Refunds

Cancellation and refund policies vary by event. Please refer to the specific event or conference details for cancellation terms. Generally:

  • Refund requests must be submitted in writing to our contact email
  • Refunds, if approved, will be processed within 14 business days
  • Administrative fees may apply to cancellations
  • No refunds will be issued for no-shows or late cancellations unless otherwise specified

3.5 Group Bookings

For group bookings, the person making the booking (the "Group Leader") is responsible for:

  • Providing accurate information for all attendees
  • Ensuring all attendees meet age requirements for their ticket type
  • Completing all required forms and consents for child and teen attendees
  • Making all payments on behalf of the group
  • Communicating event information to all group members

4. Child and Teen Registrations

For child and teen registrations, parents or guardians must:

  • Provide accurate emergency contact information
  • Disclose any relevant medical conditions, allergies, or dietary restrictions
  • Provide necessary consent waivers for medical treatment, photography/videography, and activities
  • Ensure the child or teen is aware of and agrees to participate in the event

We reserve the right to refuse registration or remove a child or teen from an event if we believe it is in the best interest of the child, other attendees, or the event.

5. Discount Codes

Discount codes are subject to terms and conditions specified at the time of issue. We reserve the right to:

  • Limit the use of discount codes to specific ticket types or events
  • Set expiration dates for discount codes
  • Limit the number of times a discount code can be used
  • Revoke or modify discount codes at any time

6. Intellectual Property

All content on this website, including text, graphics, logos, images, and software, is the property of Mission Life Grace or its content suppliers and is protected by UK and international copyright laws.

You may not reproduce, distribute, modify, create derivative works of, publicly display, or otherwise use any content from this website without our prior written permission.

7. Limitation of Liability

To the fullest extent permitted by law, Mission Life Grace shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or any loss of profits or revenues, whether incurred directly or indirectly, or any loss of data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses resulting from:

  • Your use or inability to use our website or services
  • Any unauthorized access to or use of our servers or any personal information stored therein
  • Any interruption or cessation of transmission to or from our website
  • Any bugs, viruses, trojan horses, or the like that may be transmitted to or through our website
  • Any errors or omissions in any content or for any loss or damage incurred as a result of the use of any content

8. Indemnification

You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Mission Life Grace, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including legal fees) arising out of or relating to your use of our website or services, your violation of these Terms and Conditions, or your violation of any rights of another.

9. Third-Party Services

Our website uses third-party services, including PayPal for payment processing. Your use of these services is subject to their respective terms and conditions and privacy policies. We are not responsible for the practices of third-party service providers.

10. Changes to Terms

We reserve the right to modify these Terms and Conditions at any time. We will notify users of any material changes by posting the updated terms on this page and updating the "Last updated" date. Your continued use of our website after such changes constitutes your acceptance of the new terms.

11. Governing Law

These Terms and Conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales. Any disputes arising from these terms or your use of our website shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.

12. Contact Us

If you have any questions about these Terms and Conditions, please contact us:

Mission Life Grace

542 Westhorne Avenue, Eltham, London, SE9 6RR

Email: enquiries@missionlifegrace.net

cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.content:
1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and to provide information to website owners.

This Cookie Policy explains how Mission Life Grace uses cookies and similar technologies on our website, and how you can control them.

2. How We Use Cookies

We use cookies for the following purposes:

2.1 Essential Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as:

  • Admin Authentication: Session cookies that allow authorized administrators to access the admin area of the website
  • Security: Cookies that help protect against unauthorized access and maintain security

Cookie Name: admin_session
Purpose: Maintains your login session when accessing the admin area
Duration: Session (deleted when you close your browser)
Type: First-party, HTTP-only cookie

2.2 Functional Cookies

These cookies enhance the functionality of our website and improve your experience:

  • Draft Booking Storage: We use browser localStorage (not traditional cookies) to save your conference booking progress so you can return to complete it later
  • Session Storage: We use browser sessionStorage to temporarily store booking information during the payment process

Storage Type: Browser localStorage
Key: conference-booking-draft-[conference-id]
Purpose: Saves your booking form progress (selected tickets, attendee information) so you can return to complete your booking
Duration: Until you complete the booking or clear your browser data
Data Stored: Booking form state, selected tickets, attendee details (no payment information)

Storage Type: Browser sessionStorage
Key: pendingBookingId
Purpose: Temporarily stores booking ID during PayPal payment redirect
Duration: Session (deleted when you close your browser tab)

2.3 Third-Party Cookies

We use third-party services that may set their own cookies:

PayPal

When you make a payment through PayPal, PayPal sets cookies on your device to process your payment securely. These cookies are controlled by PayPal and are subject to PayPal's own cookie policy.

Purpose: Payment processing, fraud prevention, and security
Privacy Policy: PayPal Privacy Policy

3. Types of Cookies We Use

Cookie Name Purpose Duration Type
admin_session Maintains admin login session Session Essential, First-party
localStorage: conference-booking-draft-* Saves booking form progress Until booking completed or cleared Functional, First-party
sessionStorage: pendingBookingId Temporarily stores booking ID during payment Session Functional, First-party
PayPal Cookies Payment processing and security Varies (see PayPal policy) Third-party

4. Managing Cookies

You have the right to accept or reject cookies. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser settings to decline cookies if you prefer.

4.1 Browser Settings

You can control cookies through your browser settings. Here are links to instructions for popular browsers:

  • Google Chrome
  • Mozilla Firefox
  • Safari
  • Microsoft Edge

4.2 Clearing LocalStorage and SessionStorage

To clear browser storage (localStorage and sessionStorage):

  • Chrome/Edge: Open Developer Tools (F12) Application tab Storage Clear site data
  • Firefox: Open Developer Tools (F12) Storage tab Right-click and select "Delete All"
  • Safari: Open Developer Tools (Cmd+Option+I) Storage tab Clear storage

Note: Disabling cookies or clearing browser storage may affect the functionality of our website, particularly:

  • You may not be able to access the admin area
  • Your booking form progress may not be saved
  • You may need to re-enter information during the booking process

5. Do Not Track Signals

Some browsers include a "Do Not Track" (DNT) feature that signals to websites you visit that you do not want to have your online activity tracked. Currently, there is no standard for how DNT signals should be interpreted. Our website does not currently respond to DNT signals.

6. Changes to This Cookie Policy

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date.

7. Contact Us

If you have any questions about our use of cookies or this Cookie Policy, please contact us:

Mission Life Grace

542 Westhorne Avenue, Eltham, London, SE9 6RR

Email: enquiries@missionlifegrace.net
